result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With the sentence the defendant is serving,  with 20 days credit. Time served disposition. The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges. The court imposed but stayed the DV surcharge.
*Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer Anne Grimaldi

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi in custody.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing. 
Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction, concurrent with the sentence the defendant is serving,  with 20 days credit.  Time served disposition.

The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges.  The court imposed but stayed the DV surcharge.  
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.
As to charge as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi not in court, in custody.  William Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
William Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
The case remains calendared for a jury trial on 04/04/2016 at 08:30 a.m.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
Case calendared for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug testing. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: ARK (DOB: 9/15/66)
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Jennifer Anne Grimaldi in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
